title: Creamy Broccoli Cheddar Soup for Quick Comfort

description: Savor the rich flavors of creamy broccoli cheddar soup, a delightful and quick dish perfect for cozy evenings. Ready in no time, this comforting bowl is a family favorite.
instructions: In a large pot, sauté the chopped onion and minced garlic until translucent.
Add the broccoli florets and vegetable broth to the pot. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat, simmering until broccoli is tender.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in the heavy cream and shredded cheddar cheese until melted and well combined.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
tips: For a thicker soup, blend longer until smooth. Adjust seasoning after adding cheese for best flavor. Serve with crusty bread for a complete meal.

structured_content.content: I stumbled upon this creamy broccoli cheddar soup recipe during a chilly evening when I craved something warm and comforting. It quickly became a family favorite, with everyone asking for seconds!

  • Essential aromatics/flavor elements: Onion and garlic - enhance the soup's depth

upload.context: Fresh broccoli florets with chopped onion and garlic arranged on a kitchen counter ready for cooking.

structured_content.content:
Initial Setup:
Chop the onion and mince the garlic. Prepare broccoli florets.
Main Cooking Phase:
Sauté onion and garlic in a large pot until translucent, then add broccoli and broth, bringing to a boil.
Final Assembly:
Puree the soup, stir in cream and cheese, and season to taste.

note.label: Essential Knowledge
note.content:
• Blend the soup until smooth for a creamy texture
  • Avoid overcooking the broccoli to maintain vibrant color
  • Doneness indicator is when broccoli is tender
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days

structured_content.content: Sharing this creamy broccoli cheddar soup with my family always brings smiles. It's a reminder that simple ingredients can create heartwarming meals that everyone loves.
Add a pinch of nutmeg for warmth, or a splash of lemon juice for brightness. Top with croutons or extra cheese for added texture and flavor.
Serve with a side of crusty bread or a fresh garden salad to complement the richness of the soup.
Substitute cheddar with gouda for a smoky flavor, or use almond milk for a lighter version. For a protein boost, add cooked chicken or beans.
